abstract: Google is hoping to capitalize on both the explosion in online video and the scale of its advertising network.
snippet: Google is hoping to capitalize on both the explosion in online video and the scale of its advertising network.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Hoping to earn more from its vast advertising network, Google said it planned to begin selling ads to appear inside videos on sites across the Web.

headline.main: Google Plans Push to Sell Ads to Appear Inside Videos
headline.print_headline: Google Plans Push to Sell Ads to Appear Inside Videos

abstract: Google’s technology for personal health records, which is still in development, is getting a big endorsement from the Cleveland Clinic.
snippet: Google’s technology for personal health records, which is still in development, is getting a big endorsement from the Cleveland Clinic.
lead_paragraph: For 18 months, Google has been working to come up with a product offering and a strategy in the promising field of consumer health information. Until now, the search giant hasn’t had anything to show for its labors other than bumps along the way — delays and a management change.

headline.main: Google Health Begins Its Preseason at Cleveland Clinic

abstract: Google.org, the philanthropic arm of Google, has teamed up with the Soros Economic Development Fund and Omidyar Network in a $17 million company that will invest in small- and medium-size business in India.
lead_paragraph: Google.org, the philanthropic arm of Google, has teamed up with the Soros Economic Development Fund and Omidyar Network in a $17 million company that will invest in small- and medium-size business in India.

headline.main: Google, Soros Form Team for India Venture

abstract: Enterprise customers want their hands held. And if Google cuts prices too low, there simply isn’t enough money for it or a reseller to provide much service.
snippet: Enterprise customers want their hands held. And if Google cuts prices too low, there simply isn’t enough money for it or a reseller to provide much service.
lead_paragraph: When Google purchased Postini last year for $625 million, it was making a big commitment to the enterprise software business. But not surprisingly, Google isn’t committing itself to business as usual. And it is causing a little heat among Postini’s existing partners.

headline.main: Is Google’s Enterprise Software Too Cheap?
